Documentation for REFLEXE OpenAGE Viewer (ViewShell 0.10.0).

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api
Central components in the ViewShell application, including event handling.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.activation
Defines annotations and interfaces for declaring and accessing dependencies.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth
Services for authentication and authorization, and accessing user directories.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.config
Services for configuring ViewShell components and plug-in components.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.connector
Services for communicating with OpenAGE servers (and potentially other data stores).
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data
Interfaces for working with data sources made available by connectors.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.filter
Interfaces for defining filters for data sources made available by connectors.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.sort
Interfaces for defining sorting behavior for data sources made available by connectors.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.time
Interfaces for working with date and time data made available by connectors.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.types
Specialized interfaces for handling data types.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views
Interfaces for defining list navigation behavior for data sources made available by connectors.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.design
Services for working with default page types backed by data from default connector types, with default page workflow.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs
Services for working with real and virtual file systems, including file watcher services.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http
Services for handling HTTP communications, including management of the embedded web server.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.locale
Interfaces for working with text and data representations that vary by locale.
fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes
Services for handling themes, including templates and stylesheets for pages.
Documentation for REFLEXE OpenAGE Viewer (ViewShell 0.10.0).

ViewShell 0.10.0 package structure

Packages in the public ViewShell API are stable and available as an OSGi bundle, with the symbolic name "system.api".

All other bundles provided with the ViewShell runtime are private implementations of this API (or supporting libraries) and are subject to change without notice.

ViewShell internationalization rules

Text encoding
For input and output, files (such as templates) and text are stored and transferred with UTF-8 encoding.
Date and time encoding
All dates and times are stored and transmitted between components in UTC. Conversion to other time zones should be done only where necessary for external input and output (such as processing HTTP requests/responses for an end-user with a web browser).
